conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: elevated angled view, extruded walls with thickness, multiple wall faces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and clear room volumes; minor simplifications in wall detailing and opening geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout resembles the 2D plan (central living/dining core, kitchen to left, bedrooms to right), but some room proportions/partition placements appear shifted and at least one bedroom/bed placement suggests possible room-count or boundary mismatch versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture sets are present (living seating, dining table, multiple beds), kitchen block elements included, and bathroom fixtures appear in the wet areas; minor mismatches in which rooms contain beds vs plan intent.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and good readability of walls/floors/openings; lighting is adequate though some openings/door details are stylized and less precise.

detected_errors.description: Partitioning/proportions do not fully match the 2D plan; at least one room boundary or bedroom allocation appears altered (potential extra/relocated bedroom space compared to the 2D layout).
Several doors/windows appear simplified and may not align exactly in position/swing/orientation with the 2D plan.
Rendering uses simplified geometry for trims/openings which slightly reduces verification precision.

summary: A clearly valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability, but with noticeable layout/partition proportion deviations and some door/window placement simplifications versus the 2D plan.
